headline: Robinhood, Applovin jump as S&P 500 reshuffle boosts index entrants
summary: Investing.com -- Shares of Robinhood Markets Inc (NASDAQ:HOOD) surged 7.1% in after-hours trading Friday, following the announcement of its inclusion in the S&P 500 index. The trading platform is joined by Applovin Corp (NASDAQ:APP), which climbed 7.4%, and EMCOR Group Inc (NYSE:EME), up 2.6%, highlighting investor enthusiasm after S&P Dow Jones Indices unveiled sweeping changes to its major benchmarks.

raw.headline: Robinhood, Applovin jump as S&P 500 reshuffle boosts index entrants
raw.summary: Investing.com -- Shares of Robinhood Markets Inc (NASDAQ:HOOD) surged 7.1% in after-hours trading Friday, following the announcement of its inclusion in the S&P 500 index. The trading platform is joined by Applovin Corp (NASDAQ:APP), which climbed 7.4%, and EMCOR Group Inc (NYSE:EME), up 2.6%, highlighting investor enthusiasm after S&P Dow Jones Indices unveiled sweeping changes to its major benchmarks.

headline: AppLovin, Robinhood Markets and Emcor Group Set to Join S&P 500; Others to Join S&P 100, S&P MidCap 400 and S&P SmallCap 600
summary: S&P Dow Jones Indices ("S&P DJI") will make the following changes to the S&P 100, S&P 500, S&P MidCap 400, and S&P SmallCap 600 indices effective prior to the open of trading on Monday, September 22, to coincide with the quarterly rebalance. The changes ensure each index is more representative of its market capitalization range. The companies being removed from the S&P SmallCap 600 are no longer representative of the small-cap market space.

The changes ensure each index is more representative of its market capitalization range. The companies being removed from the S&P SmallCap 600 are no longer representative of the small-cap market space.

headline: Office Worker Eats Same $1.25 Lunch Daily—One Egg, Rice, Half An Avocado—Says It Saves $2,500 A Year While Coworkers Splurge On Pizza And Donuts
summary: Every office has a cast of characters, but few are as unforgettable as the colleague who treats lunch not as a break but as a financial strategy. Forget $14 salads and overpriced poke bowls — one man has reduced his mid-day meal to three items and a principle. The story hit the Frugal subreddit under the title, "My coworker eats the exact same $1.25 meal every day and I'm weirdly impressed."
